cluster_relations.rel_desc: Forensic science analyzes physical evidence as part of its practice.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A forensic or investigative actor examines evidence or data to extract information, patterns, or insights.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Forensic scientists collect and analyze evidence.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: The subject examines, evaluates, or analyzes the object as part of an investigative or professional activity.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: in the course of forensic investigations

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Forensic scientists investigate the crime scene by meticulously documenting its details.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Denotes that an investigator examines or investigates a crime scene or context.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Forensic scientists analyze complex data as part of their role.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A forensic or investigative actor examines evidence or data to extract information, patterns, or insights.

args.canonical_rel_desc: A forensic or investigative actor examines evidence or data to extract information, patterns, or insights.
args.justification: All three relations describe the same cognitive/analytical predicate where a forensic actor analyzes evidence or data. Normalizing them to a single canonical_rel_name ('analyzes'), shared description, and shared rel_cls ('forensic_cognitive_activity_relation') improves schema consistency. The second relation previously used a more generic class ('behavior_action_relation') despite clearly describing an analytical activity similar to the other two.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: A forensic or investigative actor examines evidence or data to extract information, patterns, or insights.
executed_decisions.justification: All three relations describe the same cognitive/analytical predicate where a forensic actor analyzes evidence or data. Normalizing them to a single canonical_rel_name ('analyzes'), shared description, and shared rel_cls ('forensic_cognitive_activity_relation') improves schema consistency. The second relation previously used a more generic class ('behavior_action_relation') despite clearly describing an analytical activity similar to the other two.
